title: How to Play Music on Your PSP

steps.headline: Acquire a USB cord for your PSP.
steps.description: I would suggest a data transfer/charging cord. It kills two birds with one stone, for a dollar or so more.

steps.headline: Plug the USB cord into the computer, if you have a USB 2.0 port that is open, plug into that.
steps.description: It allows for a much faster data transfer.

steps.headline: Plug the USB B end into the PSP.
steps.description: Then, on the PSP, go to the settings column (far left),scroll down to and select "USB connection".

steps.headline: Click on the icon for the PSP, which should now appear in My Computer.
steps.description: Your computer may also bring up an autoplay box (assuming you are using Windows). 3Open the folder labeled "PSP"

steps.headline: Minimize the PSP window, and go the music folder on your PC
Select all the music that you want to copy into the PSP, remember the Ctrl key for individual selections
Drag and drop, or copy and paste your selections into the PSP's music folder.
Disconnect the PSP from the USB cord, your music should now appear alphabetically by artist in the music folder on your PSP.
Flip the switch on the left hand side of your PSP.
Go to www.beemp3.com This will bring you to a website.
steps.description: You can search for any music and download it for free in about 10 secs. It saves it to your PSP music folder.

text:
Steps Acquire a USB cord for your PSP. I would suggest a data transfer/charging cord. It kills two birds with one stone, for a dollar or so more. Plug the USB cord into the computer, if you have a USB 2.0 port that is open, plug into that. It allows for a much faster data transfer. Plug the USB B end into the PSP. Then, on the PSP, go to the settings column (far left),scroll down to and select "USB connection". Click on the icon for the PSP, which should now appear in My Computer. Your computer may also bring up an autoplay box (assuming you are using Windows). 3Open the folder labeled "PSP" Open the folder labeled "MUSIC" Minimize the PSP window, and go the music folder on your PC Select all the music that you want to copy into the PSP, remember the Ctrl key for individual selections Drag and drop, or copy and paste your selections into the PSP's music folder. Disconnect the PSP from the USB cord, your music should now appear alphabetically by artist in the music folder on your PSP. Alternate Method Flip the switch on the left hand side of your PSP. This WLAN Switch this enables you to go online. If you haven't already set up a thing to go online, it's easy. Go to your menu and scroll all the way to the right at the end go down where your web browser or internet is and press that. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bd/Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/aid285912-v4-728px-Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":260,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"411","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Just mess with the connection controls and you can get a perfect connection. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/29/Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/aid285912-v4-728px-Play-Music-on-Your-PSP-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":260,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"411","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Go to www.beemp3.com This will bring you to a website. You can search for any music and download it for free in about 10 secs. It saves it to your PSP music folder.
